### Input format 

This data viewer accepts three types of input formats: .csv, .tsv, and .txt. By default, this viewer recognize the input file as csv.

You could adjust the separator used in your variants data set using the `File Extension` drop-down for individual variant type.

#### Single Nucleotide Variants:

Input file should conform to maf files format, with the following list of fields:

> Tumor_Sample_Barcode, Hugo_Symbol, Chromosome, Start_Position, End_Position, Reference_Allele, Tumor_Seq_Allele2, Variant_Classification, Variant_Type, Protein_Change

#### Structural Variants:

Input file should have these mandatory fields:

> Tumor_Sample_Barcode, Chromosome1, Start_Position_1, Chromosome2, Start_Position_2

#### Copy Number Variants:

Input file should have these mandatory fields:

> Start_Position, End_Postion, Reads_Ratio
